title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 22
author: various
snippet: Kirsty was a remarkably weel-faur'd woman, and anumber o' the farm lads round about used to come and see her, as weel astrades' chields frae about Coldstream and Birgham--no that she gied themony encouragement, but that it was her misfortune to hae a gude-lookingface.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 22
author: various
snippet: Kirsty was a remarkably weel-faur'd woman, and anumber o' the farm lads round about used to come and see her, as weel astrades' chields frae about Coldstream and Birgham--no that she gied themony encouragement, but that it was her misfortune to hae a gude-lookingface.

title: The Scottish cavalier;
author: Grant, James
snippet: " Certes, it was grand, my lord, and a bleeze weel worth riding to Birgham to see.
